name: closefriend
text: British people have the best dirty talk, even vicariously.

name: 1000hz
text: Tabloid alliteration at its most accurate.

name: gussiejives
text:
Except Ray isn't a tabby cat. Tabby cats have striped patterns.

It's close though.

name: ford
text: so... American Curloid alliteration?

name: achtung
text: there's been some misunderstanding here in this comment thread

name: patkun
text: How could the author have enough experiance of british tabloids to parody them? He's full of surprises...

name: soticoto
text: If he knew enough to be aware that the Daily Star is the paper most likely to make mention of cake-sitting antics...  rather than it just being coincidence... then I have sorely underestimated him.

name: semiquaver
text: I like the idea that Onstad is actually a merciless genius on every topic, to the point that Achewood is actually an exercise in relaxation for him and he is such as secretly running Europe.

name: farqussus
text: you don't have to crowbar 'such as' into otherwise funny posts. It is such as unnecessary.

name: semiquaver
text: It happens when I am such as tired.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Does your name mean eighth note?

name: gouldgonewild
text: sixteenth is what I meant

name: semiquaver
text: Totally. Thank you for knowing that or at least being curious enough to google it. Most people just ask about it. It's like, hello, the internet is right there.

name: haruspex
text: You are even on it such as right now!

name: numberkillinger
text: Actually, while the Daily Star is a trashy nipple-fest, the Morning Star is such as a socialist newspaper.

name: cracklewater
text:
I didn't know there was a Morning Star paper; thanks for the info.

I thought the Daily Morning Star might have been a subtle reference to the fact that all UK tabloids serve the interests of Lucifer.

name: soticoto
text: You're thinking of the Sunday Sport.

name: hereward
text: Onstad has a crush on england is the reason.

name: johnnyrocker
text: AHH! A Shark!

name: sargasm
text: AMERICAN AUTHOR APES ANGLO ARTICLES; AMUSES AUDIENCE

name: tinhand
text: A comment left by tinhand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dri-ft, gothfae, rowboat, aquamuffin, Semiquaver, yingkaixing, puguglypress, mattylite)

name: twohundredninety
text:
It would make sense to attribute the confusion to the character and not to the author.

I mean, I have no idea if Onstad knows that judo doesn't involve striking, but I guarantee Ray doesn't.

name: helloftubby
text: the best part is that it is a kick 'on' the face.

name: morypcaina
text: Austin Powers later says "Judo trip!" which is obviously not a judo technique

name: odei
text: One of the first things I learnt in Judo was to trip someone up.

name: epicurus
text:
Yes, but the names of judo throws always sound like someone who is confused about how to sneeze, and never something so neat as "Judo Trip".

Favorites include:
"Kosoto Gari"
"Deashi Harai"
and
"Harai Goshi Gaeshi"


Just picture someone sneezing and saying any of those, but in a tone of voice that ends in a big question mark.

You are now a Judoka.

name: cracklewater
text: O goshi!

name: johnnyrocker
text: More like O gay shi.

name: afrothunder
text: More like O goddamn you for making me laugh so hard at a Venture brothers reference that I stabbed myself on a bottle opener. (No worries, it was mostly my fault for being a bit drunk. Also, it only broke the skin. I am fine)

name: dumbeast
text: Chubby for "confused about how to sneeze"

name: semiquaver
text: Others have made the accurate point that these references are both to unreliable characters in comedic works, and that they are probably deliberate foul-ups for the sake of humor.

name: carlyle
text:
I thought he said Cheetah chop.

Inane me!

name: aaron_haynes
text: "I desire to see the Queen grin pastries mercilessly beneath her nude bottom" gets a laugh from me every single time.

name: aaron_haynes
text: grind. blech.

name: stereo
text: I, on the other hand, do desire to see the Queen grin, pastries all mercilessly laying beneath her most nudeness.

name: honesttom
text: Waterbury reads the Morning Star? So, not only a spy, but a Commie to boot.

name: andyfaewatford
text: Not only a spy, but a fan of the daily nipple count...

name: andyfaewatford
text: Now I'm not one to be all sensitive about lames and such, but Lumus, did I really deserve that one? Really?

name: connellingus
text: That tabloid is one of the best punchlines on any arc in this strip. It's right up there with the Drudge Report's depiction of Ray's blubbering in the Lazarus arc.

name: nice_enuf_guy
text: Goodbye, dear Waterbury. You shall be missed, sir.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Damn fine butler gone. One with such as all Secret Agent skillz, and a good advisor as to Sunday wear.
Too bad, Ray. They're hard to find.

name: euphemisms
text: question: does the animal world in britain have their own queen? i'm trying to think of the logistics here, the tabloids should have more interest in a talking cat soliciting the queen.

name: slalvation
text:
Your question suggests the possibility that the animal world in Britain is going around without a queen.

Clearly, that would be madness.

name: epicurus
text: I love how even the stock photo of Ray is him finding money.

name: rowboat
text: Seems to me that he's offering money to the owner of a rounded rump for the rum-raisin roulades ruining service. But who knows?

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: well if that wasn't a dirt dogg of a dinner

name: dusty
text: Dang, if a guy of low means goes to that kind of trouble just eat the damn chicken.

name: seymourglass
text: The caption in the news harkens us back to Ray's peculiar proclivities already uncovered by Roast Beef.

name: the_voice
text: Judo and kicks on the face. The whole time.

name: saulbellow
text:
Kicked me on the face.

I think it takes a special kind of person to think wrong prepositions are funny. A special kind of person like me .

name: rykan
text: £1?? Sod off! Even the Torigraph is cheaper than that.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i am guessing you trying to alt plus one five six us here.

name: fattypneumonia
text: "Rum-raisin roulades" is right up there for alliterative goodness with "crumb-crisp coating."

name: twells
text: Doesn't actually say The Daily Star. Not a real paper. Smoke up Onstad's arse not necissary

name: nixnada
text:
"possibly said by..."
yep, sounds like a British newspaper.
